metadata.title: CVE-2017-7375 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw in libxml2 allows remote XML entity inclusion with default parserflags (i.e., when the caller did not request entity substitution, DTDvalidation, external DTD subset loading, or default DTD attributes).Depending on the context, this may expose a higher-risk attack surface inlibxml2 not usually reachable with default parser flags, and expose contentfrom local files, HTTP, or FTP servers (which might be otherwiseunreachable).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7375` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.3').
